It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which includes many plants with nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant is characterized by its small, upright growth habit and clusters of pea-like flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Christia hainanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
